page.title: 01REVIEW OF MOORSHOLM AREA
page.content: Block GR04680513 is approximately 6 km E. of Guisborough just S. of the A171. The S.E. corner is in the N. Yorkshire Moors National Park. The height above sea level varies from 450 to 650 feet. It is of predominantly agricultural land mainly used for livestock. A small area is wooded, mostly flanking 2 streams lying N. to S. There are 2 farming villages, Liverton, the smaller one, lies in the N.E. corner of the block. It has a Church, a Pub and a few houses. Moorsholm is on the W. side of the block situated on an unclassified road which is prone to subsidence. This road connects Moorsholm with Liverton and then on to Loftus. There is very little through traffic. There are 2 shops, Post Office, Church, Chapel, Village Hall and a Public House.
